meanings.definition: A portion or share of something that is allocated to a person or group.
meanings.sent1: The community garden had small allotments for each family to grow vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The government distributed the land allotments to the indigenous tribes.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best allotments in the school project was fierce.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was an allotment of love that she shared with everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The allotments of time we have are precious, so we must use them wisely.

meanings.definition: The action of allocating or distributing something.
meanings.sent1: The allotments of resources were carefully planned by the team.
meanings.sent2: The allotments of funds were made based on the project's needs.
meanings.sent3: The allotments of snacks at the party disappeared within minutes.
meanings.sent4: The allotments of tasks among the group members were fair and balanced.
meanings.sent5: The allotments of responsibilities were clearly outlined in the job description.
